title: 1.1 Algorithms
content:
Section 1.1

Algorithms

Summary

What exactly is an algorithm? A step-by-step procedure for solving a problem.

Key Points

  • An algorithm is a well-defined computational procedure
  • Takes input, produces output
  • Must be correct (solve the problem) and efficient (use reasonable resources)
  • Sorting is used as the main example throughout the book

Example

Sorting: Input = sequence of numbers, Output = sorted sequence. Many algorithms exist: insertion sort, merge sort, quicksort, etc.

Why It Matters

Algorithms are the foundation of all computer programs. Better algorithms = faster programs.
